author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
The Fallaga listed alleged atrocities against Muslims across the world

The website of Hinjewadi Industries Association (HIA), the umbrella body of software companies located in the Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park at Hinjewadi here, has been hacked by the Islamist hacker group, Tunisian Fallaga.

Anil Patwardhan, HIA president, said the website was hacked last week. “We have immediately got it disabled. The five-year-old website was not much in use and we are in the process of launching a new one,” said Mr. Patwardhan. While the HIA has not registered a formal complaint, the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad has already stepped in and is probing the case.

A screenshot of the HIA website read that the site had been hacked by “Dr. Avatar & Fallag Firas & Fallag XTN, part of the Tunisian Fallaga Team.”
title: Website of Pune body hacked by Tunisian outfit
